utterances.sentences: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Greg loves his Twitter right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No. It's a love-hate. There's an ambivalence there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a hate-hate, actually.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Now it's a hate-hate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you know what it is? Twitter exists on our own vanity and desire for attention. At this point, if you have a career in a family, you should consider leaving Twitter because of this very example.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You have a career and a family.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, yes, that's true. That's why I'm talking to myself. I'm trying to work through some issues here. The press thought it was hilarious. There was -- if you look at the blue-check mob, you know, those are the people that think they're really important. They're in the first class at Twitter, because they've got a little blue check, and they love -- they love that blue check.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I've got one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They said they were going to pay for the guy's health care if he lost his job. Or they were going to buy him a pizza. What if somebody went to the blue-check mob and started tweeting out, like, pornography and cost them their job, or racist stuff? Or what if you went to Juan's account and said, "I'm going to start kill short people, starting today at 'The Five'"? You know, it's like...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He does slay you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: ... you can ruin...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Go with him first.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you can ruin people's lives. So it's like, I think that, you know, if it can happen this easily, you know, you could probably do far worse. I think maybe it's time to, like, figure out something better to do with your time. And again, I'm talking to me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is a therapy session?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why am I -- why am I doing it?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You checked it during the show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you should see the self-control that I have, right? Last night, I had this amazing tweet directed at somebody at the media who was humble bragging beyond belief.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It was so good. And he even asked permission from friends, like, "Can I tweet this?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I said, "Can I send this out to this -- ? Because this person deserves it." And then you just -- what did you say?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I didn't reply, but Tom Shillue said you should do it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But you know what I think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Never listen to Shillue.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So here's what I think about this, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think there was a time when you can drive people to watch "The Five" via Twitter, and I think you believe that. So I mean, you were using it...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I do that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK. But I think you've said now you don't believe that's the case.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think that people come to the show because they love the show; they look forward to it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Twitter right remind you something is on. Like, but it doesn't do that...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We need something that is just for, like, break -- so you can follow the news and what's happening without -- without the Twitter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You mean Drudge?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, but...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hey, hey, hey. Stop this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: But at least it also tells you, you can highlight what's going to be on the show for that day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true. My problem is I just wake up in the morning and I go, "Oh God, what have I done?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: "Facebook Friday."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But so here's Trump. You're talking to yourself, but talk to Trump. So Dana, Trump said he wouldn't be president -- he wouldn't be president without Twitter.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He might be right. No, he utilizes it very well. And one of the things that was key in the election, when it came down to the general election candidates of Trump and Clinton, is that he obviously was doing the tweeting himself and it was authentic, and she obviously was not. When Neera Tanden was doing her tweets, they were actually pretty funny. But the ones that were just sanitized and boring, nobody likes that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So for example, I'm going to tweet this weekend about the Eagles. You here that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. What are you going to tweet, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That they won?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, get out. All right. The Washington football team is going to win. Our social media accounts are running just fine here. "Facebook Friday," up next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yay!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Forty-three's favorite movie, "Caddyshack." Correct?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Interesting.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not surprising.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Facebook Friday." A little bit of trivia for you at home. Because I care about you. All right. This is from Frank F. Ooh, this is a great question, Frank, if you actually exist.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "If you got stuck in the elevator for eight hours, which FOX person, and only one, would you choose to be stuck with and why?" And we're referring to the remaining employees.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my goodness...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my goodness.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No call backs? Yes. I mean, this happened to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who was it?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I was with myself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Remember when I got trapped in the elevator...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's right. That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: ... at 4:57? And then I dragged somebody...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Freight elevator.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Who did I drag in there? Did I drag Luke in there?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think I did. I was like, "Help me, help me." And I thought he had the pass, and then we were both trapped.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So you would be, prefer to be stuck with yourself?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, I don't know. I don't want to get in trouble and say anybody. I mean, definitely not you, because you'll freak out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I will have a panic attack.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, you will.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have a panic attack in a normal elevator ride.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And you start taking your socks off again. Like on the plane.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's not get into that. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think I've told you. This is -- this is the scariest thing in my life. I can't deal with it. So I don't want to think about this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't like even thinking about it?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's interesting. That's like, I don't like thinking about tall places.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: About heights. Not tall places.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Tall places.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That would be everything to you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's everything. Like shelving. I can't think about shelving.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He gets shelving anxiety.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think about heights, I actually get a little dizzy. Isn't that weird? It just shows you how your brain, Jesse, you can impact your brain with thoughts.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thoughts!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I've heard that before.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The power of positive thinking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If I was to get stuck on an elevator with someone from Fox, it would be a hair and makeup artist. So when I left the elevator after eight hours and everybody was looking at me, I look good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Always thinking.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They'd have to have their tools, their implements with them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was part of the deal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You'd have to have, like -- you'd have to have a Fox News employer who's also, like, a part-time fireman. That's what happens. They always come for you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What about you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I would go with Erin Landers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Your assistant.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because she's always got, like, a bag full of stuff. Snacks, things like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She's got funny stories. She's cheerful. She doesn't panic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm actually going to go change mine. Selwyn (ph) from the News Cafe so he can cook me something for eight hours.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what's interesting, you raise a good question. If you're -- let's say you are in the elevator and there's five people that you don't know very well and you're stuck. And you're the only one that has lunch. Are you obligated to share your lunch with these people if it's, like, if you're going into two hours, or three hours.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, that would be weird if you didn't share. I mean, what's wrong with you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You paid for it. It's your food! They should have brought their own lunch.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You should pay for your own lunch. I carry lunch everywhere just in case this happens.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I'm doubling down. I definitely don't want to be stuck with you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Obviously, my choice is Lou Dobbs. Lou Dobbs could carry me in his strong arms, climbing up the elevator cable to rescue me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Poor Dobbs. I think we better pick our intern, Ryan. He's very nice and also an EMT. And like, fixed my (ph) arms.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Jack of all trades.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Interesting. I'm going to start with you, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is from Daniel K.: "What weird food combinations do you really enjoy?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, boy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Combinations.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Can I tell you one that I used to love and it's disgusting?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My grandmother on my mom's side, Grandma Brooks, she and I used to eat Miracle Whip and peanut butter sandwiches.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's pretty good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That sounds like an Elvis thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It sounds horrible now. But at the time, we really liked it with Wonder Bread.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Interesting. Interesting. What about you, Jesse? Any weird food combos?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. So my middle name is Bailey, my grandfather. And we do a Bailey Bacon Sandwich, where you take a hotdog bun, and you put bacon strips, and then you put mustard on it...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And you eat it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: ... and you just eat it like that for breakfast.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My mouth just watered. That sounds good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's very good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Actually, it sounds super tasty.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right up your alley.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Are you kidding me? It is my alley.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Odd combinations?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I don't know. Well, I make my little quesadilla pizza, cheese thing, salami, but I think that's phenomenal together. So I don't know if it's weird.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Can you please bring that in one day?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I can.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She can make one for you. Make you one in the microwave.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I can cut it in little squares.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Food court.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's like the cutest thing you've ever seen. Yes. But besides that, I don't mind something like a little peanut butter and banana Elvis sandwich.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's gross. Bananas should only be in bread, I think.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, that is in bread. What are you talking...?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I mean banana bread. I like banana bread, but I don't like the...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, but that's on bread.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: ... don't like the texture of banana. The texture is too similar to something that I find repulsive.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What is it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I won't say. It's a family show.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, my goodness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What's your weird food combination?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, the thing is, I really get a kick out of -- I'm like a child. I go into the 7-Eleven and then I put, like, root beer with blueberry flavored, you know, and all kinds of...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Terrible.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I knew you would say that. I mix them up. And even, like, people in my family are, like, "Keep that away from me."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I like root beer floats. But like...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But you know, if you go in the Freeze, you can pick any flavor you want, Kimberly, and you just make beautiful colors. But they don't...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They call me weird. But I mean, this is going to -- peanut butter and jelly. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Weird.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So weird.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You don't like it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Unique.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's gross? But it's delicious.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I'm saying -- I'm just joking because it's so banal. I don't have any weird combinations.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, let's move on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My food does not touch.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Your weird combination is "Greg" and "Gutfeld."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. True. That's true. But I -- none of my food touches on the plate.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, God.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, zip -- zip it along.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't like it if the foods touch.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Seven years old, everybody.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Separate but equal, the food on my plate! Separate but equal. Mashed potatoes here, peas here, beef here.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I like doing that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If they touch, it's over. It's over. No cats and dogs playing together on my block.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We've got to go. I know, but you won't stop talking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm just going to keep talking. "One More Thing" next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's time now for "One More Thing." And I'll start with me-me first.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I didn't know you did French.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, put up my -- I look little in that little picture!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I know. What is going on?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I know, it's like very weird. It's like I'm in a mousetrap or something. OK. My good friends, or recent friends, at Us Weekly recently visited my New York City apartment, where I gave them a sneak peek at my shoe closet. And they wanted to, you know, see the wall which I said was better than Trump's wall, Jesse, of all the shoes. So let's take a look.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: One of the big questions that I get asked all the time and I'm, like, terrified to answer or to actually know the true answer, is how many pairs of shoes do you have? There have been estimates of about 500 pairs. Dana Perino got these for me, because she's a little, like, cowgirl. She loves country music. So she really upped my coolness game.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God. Is that the cutest? When we were at PBR. And they're, like, very popular.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Those boots are flying off the shelf. They're amazing. They didn't put up the clip with the little...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That Peco (ph) box. Yes, those are cool.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I know. And my friend Danielle who's here helped me with that whole shoe wall. So thank you, Danielle.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: To quote "Us Weekly," "You're just like us."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Exactly. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Five hundred pairs.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The answer to the question is, how many pairs of shoes do you have? Not enough.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's not fine (ph), though -- yes, not enough. If my shoe size ever changed, so there we go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Mine next?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. So apparently, humans love their dogs more than fellow man. OK, so two studies come out that show that people, if you're shown -- you can get contributions to, like, a little baby or a dog. They'll go with the dog. And also, when they looked at, at Northeastern University, students are shown fake newspaper clippings about a baseball bat attack on a puppy, an adult dog, a year old infant, and a 30-year old.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Shameless.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And guess what?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're just showing pictures...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: People cared about the dogs more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She's showing pictures of Jasper. That's all that this is for. Shameless.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, it was -- well, sure.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, his fans were demanding it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Greg is such a hater. OK, Jess.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Saturday night, "Watters' World," 8 p.m. We have Ann Coulter. We have Tomi Lahren, and a psychologist who treats Trump anxiety disorder among the millennials.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Fair and balanced, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, we are. No brunettes? Is that why?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Also, there is a classic "Watters' World" quiz. Here's a little taste.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What did the Declaration of Independence do?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Um... I have no idea. That's awful.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I am not that knowledgeable on those declarations and the Constitution and all of that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What country did we declare our independence from?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Virginia.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Correct?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Real quick, "Greg Gutfeld Show" tomorrow, I've got Lauren Sivan. I've got Scott Adams, obviously, "Dilbert" fame and the guy who predicted Trump's election. It's going to be great. Tomorrow night and Sunday at 5 p.m.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And Juan has the big parade for Houston Astros.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We'll come back.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. Never miss an episode of "The Five." "Special Report" is up next. Bret, take it away. END Content and Programming Copyright 2017 Fox News Network, LLC.
